ETYMOLOGY: Shortening of earlier 'mobile vulgus' (Latin for 'excitable crowd'), in English from the late 17th century.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large crowd of people, especially one that is disorderly and intent on causing trouble or violence.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一大群人，尤指骚乱的、意图制造麻烦或暴力的群体。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: An angry mob gathered outside the courthouse demanding justice.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 一群愤怒的暴徒聚集在法院外，要求伸张正义。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An organized group of criminals, especially the Mafia.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个有组织的犯罪团伙，尤指黑手党。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He was suspected of having ties to the mob.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他被怀疑与黑帮有联系。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of a crowd) to surround (someone) in a threatening or adoring way.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (指人群) 围住 (某人)，以威胁或崇拜的方式。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The celebrity was mobbed by fans as soon as he stepped out of the car.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位名人在下车后立刻被粉丝们团团围住。

REGISTER: Informal or often derogatory depending on context.
